attributes.action: Post Brexit British Armed Forces shouldnt be integrated into an EU defence force
attributes.additional_details: Keeping Britain locked into the structures, policies and financial schemes of the new EU Defence Union in a post-Brexit world means passing control of our military to the EU at a time when the British public have voted overwhelmingly to take back that control.
attributes.background:
Boris Johnson recently announced that post-Brexit British Armed forces are to be offered for integration into the Defence Apparatus of the European Union on terms, "Closer than a third country"
This will betray British voters who voted Leave to stop the ambitions of the EU to appropriate our Forces

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 

There is currently no EU Defence Force and the Foreign Secretary didn't announce plans to integrate the British Army into a possible future EU defence force, so we're not sure what action you'd like the Government or Parliament to take. 

You can read about the Foreign Secretary's comments in context here: 
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/uk-offers-deep-security-partnership-with-eu-post-brexit-in-the-face-of-growing-global-threats

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
